conversation.content: I'm looking at my statement and there's this charge. From some company I've never heard of...
[inhales] Right. Okay. Let me pull up your account—what's the charge showing as? Sometimes our billing appears under our parent company designation, MGL Holdings LLC, reference code BIL-4492-X.
MGL Holdings? That's... yeah that's it actually. Seventy-nine ninety-five.
Got it.
So wait. You guys are MGL? Because nowhere on your website does it say...

[exhales slowly] Yeah, I know. It's—sorry, it's confusing. We're technically a subsidiary under corporate structure MGL-7734-CORP, so depending on your bank's processing system... some customers see our name, some see theirs.
That's really misleading though. I almost disputed it.
Completely understand. Let me... actually, hold on. I can send you documentation with our merchant ID MTX882JK91 that shows both names. For your records.
Okay. That would help. But why don't you just fix it so it shows...
[sighs] Trust me, we've tried. The banking integration runs through legacy system LS-9901... basically it's a three-year project to change it. Not ideal, but. That's where we are.
Three years? That seems. I mean okay. If you say so.
Right right.
So going forward all my charges will look like this? The MGL thing?
Depends on your bank actually. About sixty percent show as MGL, the rest show our actual name. Your bank's processor ID ends in 4481-B, so... yeah, you'll keep seeing MGL.
Well at least now I know. Could've saved myself some panic if someone had mentioned...
Absolutely.
Is this in the welcome email or anything? Because I don't remember seeing it mentioned anywhere...
It's in the terms—section 14.2.3 actually—but let's be real, nobody reads that. We're adding a banner to checkout. Should go live next month, implementation ticket DEV-3847-PROD.
That's good at least. Other people must call about this all the time.

[sharp inhale] Oh yeah. Call volume code CVC-19 if you're curious... it's our third most common issue. But hey, now you know, and I've got that documentation heading to your email at, let me confirm... ends in @gmail, right?

scenario: confused about charges appearing as a different company name
